Since the amalgamation of Mutsu with three neighboring towns in 2005, most of the peninsula is now technically within city limits, but this article covers only the town itself.

value: The northern command of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Forces is located on the road to Kawauchi, at the very edge of the city. Visitors can request tours of the base, which is home to several destroyers and other vessels. (Note, however, that these tours are unlikely to be available in English).
Mt. Kamafuse overlooks the city and offers a couple chair lifts in the winter and a decent hike in the summer.

Central Mutsu has a number of quaint bars and restaurants.
Mutsu has a wide selection of reasonably cheap lodgings (¥6,000 with two meals), and the tourist information office is glad to help you book.
